intro: Oldenlandia conostyla, commonly known as the silky iron vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oldenlandia conostyla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
